xxl.core.math.numerics.splines
Class CubicBezierSpline

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Function<Number,Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.numerics.splines.CubicBezierSpline
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, RealFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
RB1CubicBezierSpline, RB2CubicBezierSpline
public abstract class CubicBezierSpline
extends AbstractRealFunctionFunction

This class implements a cubic Bezier-Spline interpolation with one of the two common boundary conditions for a one-dimensional real-valued function by determining the necessary parameters.
The function, that is defined over [a,b], is evaluated on a grid [a=x_0,x_1,...,b=x_n-1]. Then for each of the grid intervals a polynomial of degree 3 is chosen that interpolates the function in the borders of the interval. These polynomials are parameterized such that the partial polynomials fit together and globally build a smooth curve. That means, the overall function is globally two times continuously differentiable. The cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate is especially qualified for approximating a function since it is in the class of interpolating functions the one with the least fraction.
For determining the unique cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate, one of two boundary conditions has to be chosen. The first one, called natural, postulates the function to fulfill a second derivative of zero in a and b. For the second condition the values of the functions first derivative in a and b has to be known. Given one of the conditions the determination of the local polynomials respectively their parameters results in the solution of a linear equation system. This equation system has the special form of a tridiagonal matrix and thus permits an efficient computation of the solution.
With the solution of the linear equation system the Bezier-coefficients can be computed. The evaluation of the spline relies on these coefficients. Generally, the spline is evaluated locally by determining the interval where the point to evaluate is located. For this interval and with the corresponding Bezier coefficients, the spline is evaluated in the Bezier-Bernstein form.
Since some of the computations do not depend on the boundary conditions, this class is abstract. In the abstract method solveLGS<\code> the boundary conditions are included. Otherwise, this class precomputes all necessary variables. The boundary conditions in turn are modelled in RB1CubicBezierSpline and RB2CubicBezierSpline.
The cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate is a Function supporting objects of type Number within the given grid. In regard to the underlying function this class extends AbstractRealFunctionFunction. Thus, the spline can also be evaluated with double values.

See Also:
RB1CubicBezierSpline, RB2CubicBezierSpline, RealFunction, Function, AbstractRealFunctionFunction, Serialized Form

Field Detail

cdfMode

protected boolean cdfMode
If a cumulative distribution function is interpolated respectively approximated, the resulting interpolate needs to be one for all values right "beside" the interval. This flag indicates that the spline is in cdf mode, i.e., evaluating the spline interpolate at x with x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0.

grid

public double[] grid
grid constituting the approximation interval

fvalues

protected double[] fvalues
grid values of the function to interpolate

a

protected double[] a
This array contains values, which are necessary for determining the Bezier-coefficients of the spline. They constitute the lower subdiagonal of the matrix A, which has to be solved to determine the polynomials coefficients.

b

protected double[] b
This array contains values, which are necessary for determining the Bezier-coefficients of the spline. They constitute the upper subdiagonal of the matrix A, which has to be solved to determine the polynomials coefficients.

rightSide

protected double[] rightSide
This array contains the divided differences of the function values. It constitutes the right side of the LGS, whose solution is necessary for determining the Bezier-coefficients.

mu

protected double[] mu
The solution of the LGS A * mu = rightSide. With those values the Bezier-coefficients are determined.

bezier

public double[] bezier
The Bezier-coefficients are necessary for invoking the spline.

distance

protected double[] distance
This array contains the distances between the nodes of the grid.

deviation

protected double[] deviation
This array contains, if known, the two values of the first derivative of f at the borders.

dim

protected int dim
The number of grid nodes.

init

protected boolean init
Indicates whether the spline has been initialized or not.

Constructor Detail

CubicBezierSpline

protected CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim,
                            boolean cdfMode)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. The cdf mode has to be set manually.

Parameters:
grid - grid points to the corresponding function values
fvalues - function values at the grid points
deviation_0 - value of the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
deviation_dim - value of the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid
cdfMode - indicates if the function is in cdf mode
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the given arrays do not match

CubicBezierSpline

protected CubicBezierSpline(double a,
                            double b,
                            int n,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            double deviation_0,
                            double deviation_dim)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the second boundary condition based upon an equidistant grid and the corresponding function values. Also the values of the second derivative at the borders are given. Initially, the cdf mode is set to false.

Parameters:
a - left border of the grid
b - right border of the grid
n - number of grid points
fvalues - function values on the grid points
deviation_0 - the first derivative of f at the left border of the grid
deviation_dim - the first derivative of f at the right border of the grid

CubicBezierSpline

protected CubicBezierSpline(double[] grid,
                            double[] fvalues,
                            boolean cdfMode)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. The cdf mode has to be set manually.

Parameters:
grid - grid points to the corresponding function values
fvalues - function values at the grid points
cdfMode - indicates if the function is in cdf mode
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the given arrays doesn't match

CubicBezierSpline

                            double[] fvalues)
Constructs a cubic Bezier-Spline with the first boundary condition based upon a grid and the corresponding function values. The cdf mode is set to false.

Parameters:
grid - grid points to the corresponding function values
fvalues - function values at the grid points

Method Detail

solveLGS

protected abstract double[] solveLGS()
This method solves the linear equation system depending on the chosen boundary condition. Extending classes need to implement this method to support the different choices of boundary conditions.

Returns:
solution of the linear equation system

initSettings

protected void initSettings()
This method determines the parameters of the spline that are independent from the chosen boundary condition.

bezierCoeff

protected void bezierCoeff()
This method determines the Bezier-coefficients based on the solution of the linear equation system.

eval

public double eval(double x)
Evaluates the spline at a given point. If the spline is not initialized yet, the Bezier-coefficients are computed. For values outside the grid, zero will be returned or, if the cdf mode is true and x > right border, one will be returned.

Specified by:
eval in interface RealFunction
Specified by:
eval in class AbstractRealFunctionFunction
Parameters:
x - double value where the spline will be evaluated
Returns:
value of the spline at point x

interpolationSearch

protected static int interpolationSearch(double[] a,
                                         double x)
Searches the corresponding double array for the specified value using the interpolation search algorithm. The array must be sorted (as by the sort method, above) prior to making this call. If it is not sorted, the results are undefined. If the array contains multiple elements with the specified value, there is no guarantee which one will be found.

Parameters:
a - array to be searched
x - searched value
Returns:
index i with x \in [g[i], g(i+1) ) if x \in [g[0], g[n-1] ), otherwise -1

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
